Package bcu.cmp5332.librarysystem.data

Interface DataManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
BookDataManager, LoanDataManager, PatronDataManager
public interface DataManager
An object that loads and stores data to the text file storage.

The interface has a field that holds the value of a predefined sparator that will be used to separate different entities' properties when saved as a line of text. It also provides two methods, one that can be used to load data from the text file storage to a Library object and one that can be used to store data from a Library object to the text file system.

Different implementations can exist for this interface and each one can be used to load and store data for different entities (e.g BookDataManager can be used to load and store book data, PatronDataManager for patron data, etc.).

See Also:
SEPARATOR, loadData(Library), storeData(Library), BookDataManager

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static java.lang.String SEPARATOR
    The separator that will be used to separate the values of the different object properties when saved in a single line.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void loadData​(Library library)
    Load data from the file storage to the library.
    void storeData​(Library library)
    Store data from the library to the text file storage.

  • Field Details

    • SEPARATOR

      static final java.lang.String SEPARATOR
      The separator that will be used to separate the values of the different object properties when saved in a single line.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • loadData

      void loadData​(Library library) throws java.io.IOException, LibraryException
      Load data from the file storage to the library.
      Parameters:
      library - the library object where the data will be loaded to
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong while reading from the file
      LibraryException - implementing functions can throw this to send notifications to the user

    • storeData

      void storeData​(Library library) throws java.io.IOException
      Store data from the library to the text file storage.
      Parameters:
      library - the library object whose data will be stored in the file
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong while writing to the file
